Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Last winter, dozens of locals gathered outside to honk and cheer as one Democrat left town.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: dozens of locals gathered outside to honk and cheer as one Democrat left town; they weren’t cheering as Ed Fullmer was headed off for good; Fullmer was on the high school boys basketball team bus as they left for the state championship

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Niobrara County’s Democrats, who account for just 2.6% of registered voters, are the most outnumbered by Republicans in the 30 states that track local party affiliation, according to Associated Press election data.
Document Sources.Source Justification: according to Associated Press election data

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "Normally I just roll my eyes and walk away because I’m fighting a losing battle and I’m fully aware of that," she said. "Maybe that is why I’m well-liked, because I keep my mouth shut 10 times more than I want to."
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: A paralegal for the Republican county attorney; served nine years on the Town Council; flies an LGBTQ+ flag in support of her lesbian daughter; stocks up on Democratic political signs

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "How far are they going to go to limit one’s ability to vote? If it really comes down to purifying the party, on a voting level all the way up to the elected officials, pretty soon there isn’t going to be anyone left who’s pure enough to be in the party," Diercks said.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Former State Representative; Former Middle School English Teacher
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: A former middle school English teacher; beat a Republican incumbent in 1992 to launch an 18-year run in the Legislature; temporarily switched parties to vote in the GOP primary

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "The best way to participate in meaningful change is to try to sway the dominant party," said Jordan, who lives in Niobrara County. "You know, we need to have a government that serves the people, all of them, not just Republicans and not just rural and not just urban and not just Democrats — and definitely not just the rich and the wealthy."
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Supports many left-leaning goals, including universal healthcare; lives in Niobrara County

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: "Most people don’t want to dive into those type of discussions," he said. "They respect you for what you do, how you work."
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Coached the Tigers to their best record in a decade, 20-8; high school boys basketball team bus as they left for the state championship

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The Wyoming Legislature, where the GOP controls over 90% of the seats, passed legislation last year banning voters from changing their party registration in the three months before the August primary.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: where the GOP controls over 90% of the seats; passed legislation last year banning voters from changing their party registration

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Party-switching had 'undermined the sanctity of Wyoming’s primary process,' Wyoming’s Republican secretary of state, Chuck Gray, said in a statement of approval.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Wyoming’s Republican secretary of state, Chuck Gray, said in a statement of approval
